libnetworkd::Module

libnetworkd::Module Class Reference

#include <ModuleManager.hpp>

Detailed Description

Abstract extension module interface, usually instanciated by the modules' C wrapper functions and called by the core upon module initialization and shutdown.

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool libnetworkd::Module::start ( Configuration *  configuration  )  [pure virtual]

Ask the module to start its service by registering with necessary core managers and such functionality. Provides the module with a reference to the core daemon and an already parsed configuration.

Parameters:
[in] moduleConfiguration Pre-parsed configuration.
[in] userdefined data from the daemon, mostly a set of pointers to other libnetworkd specific classes.
Returns:
Returns true if the module was started successfully or false if startup failed.

virtual bool libnetworkd::Module::stop (  )  [pure virtual]

Ask the module to gracefully stop its service by unregistering from all core managers and stopping in-progress operations. The module is afterwards unloaded regardless of the return value, but a warning may be printed to indicate ungraceful shutdown.

Returns:
True if the module could stop gracefully or false if the stop had to be enforced.

virtual const char* libnetworkd::Module::getName (  )  [pure virtual]

Provides a short, one-word name for the module.

Returns:
A static, valid string pointer to the name.

virtual const char* libnetworkd::Module::getDescription (  )  [pure virtual]

Provides a single-sentence description of the tasks this module performs or fulfills. @ return A static, valid string pointer to the description.
